head.title: Look at Lake Powell As Creative Monument

hedline.hl1: Look at Lake Powell As Creative Monument

abstract.p: Steven Landau letter on Daniel P Beard's Oct 6 article urging removal of Glen Canyon Dam from Colorado River (S)

block.p: Daniel P. Beard's support for the proposal to drain Lake Powell, in Arizona and Utah (Op-Ed, Oct. 6), is an example of environmental thinking that damages the credibility of more sensible ideas.
Daniel P. Beard's support for the proposal to drain Lake Powell, in Arizona and Utah (Op-Ed, Oct. 6), is an example of environmental thinking that damages the credibility of more sensible ideas.

It can be argued that Lake Powell and Glen Canyon dam are strikingly beautiful. The habit of disparaging humanity's impulse to control the natural environment is probably temporary. We may one day begin to see that responsible and balanced interventions are often acceptable and sometimes the highest orders of creative achievement.

Given the finite amount of money available toward improving the environment, it seems a waste to destroy this monument to American ingenuity and construction prowess that provides electricity without depleting the ozone or creating acid rain.
